articles.content:

articles.title: Marlin Briscoe, first Black starting QB in AFL, dies at age 76
articles.description: Marlin Briscoe, who became the first Black starting quarterback in the American Football League, died Monday at age 76.
articles.content:
Marlin Briscoe, who became the first Black starting quarterback in the American Football League more than 50 years ago, died Monday.

articles.title: Sources - Los Angeles Lakers only team known to be seeking Brooklyn Nets guard Kyrie Irving in a sign-and-trade deal
articles.description: The Lakers are the only team known to be interested in acquiring Nets guard Kyrie Irving in a sign-and-trade deal, sources told ESPN's Adrian Wojnarowski. Teams can execute such deals when free agency opens Thursday night.
articles.content:

articles.title: Jodie Burrage halts Wimbledon match to come to aid of fainting ballboy with candy
articles.description: British player Jodie Burrage halts Wimbledon match to come to the aid of a fainting ballboy. She first gave him a sports drink, then some nutritional gel before a spectator handed over a bag of candy.
articles.content:

articles.title: Supreme Court sides with former Bremerton, Wash. high school football coach, ruling he has Constitutional right to pray on field
articles.description: On Monday, the Supreme Court ruled in favor of Bremerton, Wash. high school football coach Joseph Kennedy, saying his after-game prayer sessions were protected by the First Amendment.
articles.content:
